qas.question: What controls do the supreme court have?
Constitutional Court provides what type of review of legislative acts?
Constitutional Court also serves as what type of arbiter?
Local disputes in rural areas are usually handled by what individuals?
What country does not have an independent judiciary?
What does the Supreme Court enforce?
What this is Supreme Court review?
What do lower courts resolve at the local level?

context: <b5_0>Mali<b5_0/>'s constitution provides for an independent judiciary, but the executive continues to exercise influence over the judiciary by virtue of power to appoint judges and oversee both judicial functions and <b6_0>law<b6_0/> enforcement. Mali's highest courts are the <a0_0>Supreme Court<a0_0/>, which has <a1_0>both judicial and administrative powers<a1_0/>, and a separate Constitutional Court that provides <a2_0>judicial review<a2_0/> of <b7_0>legislative acts<b7_0/> and serves as an <a3_0>election<a3_0/> arbiter. Various lower courts exist, though <a4_0>village chiefs and elders<a4_0/> resolve most local <b8_0>disputes<b8_0/> in rural areas.
